events.message: The claimant reported a car collision that occurred on April 29, involving damage to the front bumper and hood of their vehicle.
After review, the claim was categorised under Auto Accident due to the involvement of a personal vehicle in a traffic collision.
An insurance agent was assigned to manage the claim and provide the claimant with clear guidance throughout the process.
The insurance company formally acknowledged receipt of the claim and confirmed that the investigation will begin shortly.
The claimant was requested to submit photos of the damaged vehicle, police report, and repair estimates for further evaluation.
The claimant submitted all required documents, including detailed repair quotes and an official police report related to the accident.
The assigned investigator began reviewing the submitted evidence and contacted witnesses to determine fault and validate the claim.
The investigation concluded with a determination that the claimant was not at fault and the vehicle damage is covered under the policy.
An initial settlement amount was proposed to cover the estimated repair costs and related expenses resulting from the accident.
The claimant expressed satisfaction with the prompt handling of the claim and the clarity of communication throughout the process.
The claim was officially approved, confirming that the insurance coverage applies and payment will be processed shortly.
The insurance provider issued payment to the claimant for the approved repair costs related to the auto accident.
Following payment issuance and claimant confirmation of receipt, the claim file was officially closed in the system.
